jteissler.csci1320.simplesql

Interface StringDatabase

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    SQLDatabase

    public interface StringDatabase
    Simple SQL-like database methods which allow for tables with multiple columns of only string type data. Features like auto-increment and primary or unique keys are not implemented.
    Database and table names should contain no whitespace and conform to standard UNIX filename conventions in terms of character set.
    Author:
    J Teissler

    • Method Detail

      • createDatabase

        void createDatabase(java.lang.String database)
             throws SQLException
        Creates a new, distinct database. If a database already exists with the same name no new database will be created.
        Parameters:
        database - The name of the new database.
        Throws:
        SQLException - if an issue arose while creating the database.

      • dropDatabase

        void dropDatabase(java.lang.String database)
           throws SQLException
        Deletes a database and all of its tables.
        Parameters:
        database - The name of the database to delete.
        Throws:
        SQLException - if an issue arose while dropping the database.

      • createTable

        void createTable(java.lang.String database,
                 java.lang.String table)
          throws SQLException
        Creates a new table in the specified database. If a table already exists in the database then no new table will be created.
        Parameters:
        database - The name of the database to modify.
        table - The name of the table to create.
        Throws:
        SQLException - if an issue arose while creating the table.

      • dropTable

        void dropTable(java.lang.String database,
               java.lang.String table)
        throws SQLException
        Deletes an existing table from the specified database.
        Parameters:
        database - The name of the database to modify.
        table - The table to delete from the database.
        Throws:
        SQLException - if an issue arose while dropping the table.

      • insert

        void insert(java.lang.String database,
            java.lang.String table,
            java.lang.String value)
     throws SQLException
        Inserts a new entry into a table in a database.
        Parameters:
        database - The name of the database to modify.
        table - The table into which to insert the new data.
        value - The value to store.
        Throws:
        SQLException - if an issue arose while inserting the value.

      • update

        long update(java.lang.String database,
            java.lang.String table,
            java.lang.String value,
            java.lang.String search)
     throws SQLException
        Modifies one or more existing rows in a table.
        Parameters:
        database - The name of the database to modify.
        table - The table which to modify.
        value - The value to set.
        search - The value which will prompt a change to a row. null for all rows.
        Returns:
        The number of rows that were updated.
        Throws:
        SQLException - if an issue arose while updating the table.

      • delete

        long delete(java.lang.String database,
            java.lang.String table,
            java.lang.String search)
     throws SQLException
        Deletes one or more existing rows in a table.
        Parameters:
        database - The name of the database to modify.
        table - The table which to modify.
        search - The value to search for.
        Returns:
        The number of rows that were deleted.
        Throws:
        SQLException - if an issue arose while deleting values from the table.

      • select

        java.util.List<Pair<java.lang.Long,java.lang.String>> select(java.lang.String database,
                                                             java.lang.String table,
                                                             java.lang.String search)
                                                      throws SQLException
        Selects one or more rows of data from a table.
        Parameters:
        database - The name of the database to search.
        table - The table which to search.
        search - The value to search for. null for all values.
        Returns:
        The selected string values in a list associated with their row number.
        Throws:
        SQLException - if an issue arose while selecting values from the table.
